docs.snippet: The Yankees’ president complained that they paid more than the Mets in revenue sharing, even though taxpayers spent nearly $1 billion subsidizing the new Yankee Stadium....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees’ president complained that they paid more than the Mets in revenue sharing, even though taxpayers spent nearly $1 billion subsidizing the new Yankee Stadium.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column blasts New York Yankees president Randy Levine for complaining that Yankees pay more than New York Mets in revenue share, pointing out Yankees received $40 million sales tax exemption from city and state on their construction costs for new stadium.

headline.main: Grumbling About Socialism, the Yankees Profit From It
